Item ID11061

The ancient mace is a weapon that can be acquired during the Another Slice of H.A.M. quest. Although tradeable, it cannot be wielded until after a certain point in the quest; attempting to do so results in the message You must have received that mace in Another Slice of H.A.M in order to wield it.

The ancient mace has stats in between those of a black mace and mithril mace and requires level 15 Attack and level 25 Prayer to wield. In addition, it can be equipped for protection against the Bandosian followers in the God Wars Dungeon.

If lost, it can be retrieved from the goblin archaeologist Tegdak for 1,000 coins, north-east of the Dorgesh-Kaan marketplace.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player performing the ancient mace's special attack, Favour of the War God.

The ancient mace has a special attack, Favour of the War God, requiring 100% Special Attack energy, that hits through Protect from Melee and drains the Prayer points of the opponent by 100% of the amount hit, recharging the user's prayer points by the same amount. This can raise your current Prayer points to above your maximum Prayer level - up to the amount of damage inflicted by the attack. The special attack will restore prayer even if used against a target that has immunity to conventional weaponry such as Turoths and Kurasks, making this a useful special attack on slayer trips for restoring prayer. It is a useful tool while in the Nightmare Zone for restoring prayer after activating a power surge power-up, which gives the player infinite special attack power.

In order to maximise the number of prayer points restored, activating a melee-boosting prayer (such as Piety) and drinking strength boosting potions before using the special attack is advised. Players can use it on a combat dummy (or undead combat dummy) in a player-owned house Combat Room in conjunction with damage-boosting gear such as a salve (ei) on an undead dummy to boost their prayer points above maximum, as hitting the dummy will always result in the player's max hit. The maximum hit and prayer boost is currently 40.

Due to its extremely low price, if circumstances do not require the recouping of health and where the player only needs to recover prayer points, the Ancient Mace is a viable alternative to the Saradomin Godsword. The Ancient Mace restores the same maximum prayer points per special bar as the Saradomin Godsword: The Saradomin Godsword's special attack consumes 50% of the special bar, and has a current maximum hit of 80; it restores 50% to hitpoints and 25% to prayer (restoring a maximum of 20 prayer points per special attack); while the Ancient Mace consumes 100% of the bar; has a current max hit of 40, and restores 100% of that damage to prayer. Note that the Saradomin Godsword will restore more in the practical long run as it has a greater chance of landing a hit, and hitting a 0 with the Saradomin Godsword will still restore mimimal hp and prayer points.

The Ancient Mace is particularly advantageous in situations that do not allow players to use two-handed weapons, particularly Basilisks and Basilisk Knights, and for example on a house combat dummy where one quick attack is more beneficial than two separate attacks.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Players cannot cast High or Low Level Alchemy on the Ancient mace; doing so results in the message: This ancient artifact resists your magic. However, players can sell the mace to general stores for 400 coins.
  • Despite being described as "ancient", the mace is not associated with Zaros, whom most ancient items are affiliated with. Instead, the mace is associated with the god Bandos.

[[File:Ancient mace detail.png|left|130px]]
The '''ancient mace''' is a [[weapon]] that can be acquired during the [[Another Slice of H.A.M.]] quest. Although tradeable, it cannot be wielded until after a certain point in the quest; attempting to do so results in the message ''You must have received that mace in Another Slice of H.A.M in order to wield it''.

The ancient mace has stats in between those of a [[black mace]] and [[mithril mace]] and requires level 15 [[Attack]] and level 25 [[Prayer]] to wield. In addition, it can be equipped for protection against the [[Bandos]]ian followers in the [[God Wars Dungeon]].

If lost, it can be retrieved from the [[goblin]] archaeologist [[Tegdak]] for 1,000 [[coins]], north-east of the [[Dorgesh-Kaan]] marketplace.

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Spiked}}

==Special attack==
[[File:Favour of the War God.gif|frame|A player performing the ancient mace's special attack, ''Favour of the War God''.]]
The ancient mace has a [[special attack]], ''Favour of the War God'', requiring 100% Special Attack energy, that hits through [[Protect from Melee]] and drains the [[Prayer]] points of the opponent by 100% of the amount hit, recharging the user's prayer points by the same amount. This can raise your current Prayer points to above your maximum Prayer level - up to the amount of damage inflicted by the attack. The special attack will restore prayer even if used against a target that has immunity to conventional weaponry such as [[Turoth]]s and [[Kurask]]s, making this a useful special attack on slayer trips for restoring prayer. It is a useful tool while in the [[Nightmare Zone]] for restoring prayer after activating a power surge power-up, which gives the player infinite special attack power.

In order to maximise the number of [[prayer points]] restored, activating a melee-boosting prayer (such as [[Piety]]) and drinking strength boosting potions before using the special attack is advised. Players can use it on a [[combat dummy]] (or [[undead combat dummy]]) in a [[player-owned house]] [[Combat Room]] in conjunction with damage-boosting gear such as a [[Salve amulet(ei)|salve (ei)]] on an [[Undead combat dummy|undead dummy]] to boost their prayer points above maximum, as hitting the dummy will always result in the player's max hit. The maximum hit and prayer boost is currently 40.

Due to its extremely low price, if circumstances do not require the recouping of health and where the player only needs to recover prayer points,  the Ancient Mace is a viable alternative to the [[Saradomin Godsword]]. The Ancient Mace restores the same maximum prayer points per special bar as the Saradomin Godsword: The Saradomin Godsword's special attack consumes 50% of the special bar, and has a current maximum hit of 80; it restores 50% to hitpoints and 25% to prayer (restoring a maximum of 20 prayer points per special attack); while the Ancient Mace consumes 100% of the bar; has a current max hit of 40, and restores 100% of that damage to prayer. Note that the Saradomin Godsword will restore more in the practical long run as it has a greater chance of landing a hit, and hitting a 0 with the Saradomin Godsword will still restore mimimal hp and prayer points. 

The Ancient Mace is particularly advantageous in situations that do not allow players to use two-handed weapons, particularly Basilisks and Basilisk Knights, and for example on a house combat dummy where one quick attack is more beneficial than two separate attacks.

==Trivia==
* Players cannot cast [[High Level Alchemy|High]] or [[Low Level Alchemy]] on the Ancient mace; doing so results in the message: ''This ancient artifact resists your magic.'' However, players can sell the mace to [[general store]]s for 400 coins.
* Despite being described as "ancient", the mace is not associated with [[Zaros]], whom most ancient items are affiliated with. Instead, the mace is associated with the god Bandos.
